snippet: Immigration authorities went after people suspected of being members of gangs that smuggle people across or under the English Channel and into Britain.
abstract: Immigration authorities in Britain, Belgium and France carry out coordinated raids at scores of addresses to round up suspected members of gangs that smuggle people across or under English Channel into Britain as stowaways in long-haul trucks.

byline.original: By JOHN F. BURNS and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: John F. Burns reported from London, and Alan Cowell from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Immigration authorities went after people suspected of being members of gangs that smuggle people across or under the English Channel and into Britain.

headline.seo: Raids in Britain, France and Belgium Focus on Smugglers of People
headline.main: Raids in Britain, France and Belgium Focus on People-Smuggling
headline.print_headline:
Raids Target Gangs That Smuggle
Migrants Into Britain
